body:
Avengers: Endgame

Bits I liked

- That Carol actually did save Tony, but it was cool how.

- Tony and Nebula playing table football

- Morgan and Tony saying shit.

- “Its an earthquake - under the water”

- New Asgard.

- Valkyrie

- Korg and Miek.

- Scott eating Nats sandwich

- Scott losing his taco filling.

- Nebula calling Scott an idiot.

- “What’s up regular-sized man.”

- Hulk, Nat and Tony lying on the table, brainstorming.

- Nebula agreeing with Rhodey that Quill is an idiot.

- The ancient one helping with the Battle of New York.

- When she realised that she needed to give Bruce the time stone, because Strange gave it away.

- Loki.

- America’s ass.

- “Take the stairs.”

- “I can do this all day” scene.

- Steve swearing.

- Mjolnir being used as a Defibrilator.

- Alexander Pierce (nice throwback to Winter Soldier).

- The elevator scene.

- Peggy fucking Carter.

- Tony Stark’s almost name.

- Hawkeye and Nat trying to out sacrifice one another.

- Frigga (she was so underused the first time around).

- Thor being stil worthy of wielding Mjolnir (and his joy).

- Ant-Man going big to save Rocket and Rhodey.

- Steve wielding Mjolnir.

- Thor confiscating Stormbreaker.

- Sam’s “on your left” to Steve.

- Shuri fighting.

- Valkyries Pegasus.

- Wong’s, “You want more?”

- Captain Marvel’s entrance.

- Gauntlet football.

- Gamora saving Peter.

- “It was between him or a tree”

- “Hi, I’m Peter Parker.”

- Girl Power scene.

- “Ugly ass brown van”

- Harley Keene, Aunt May, Fury and Thaddeus Ross.

- Bucky knew Steve wasn’t coming back whilst the other two still thought he would.

- The new Captain America.

- Clint and his family.

- Asgard’s new leader.

- Asguardians of the Galaxy.

Bits I didn’t like

- Fat, drunk Thor. I’m just going to pretend Thor wasn’t in this one to be honest.

- Hulk. I’m with Valkyrie. Liked him either way, but not this way.

- No Fury and Carol interaction.

summary: Hey there   Favourite avengers movies scenes?  Favourite iron man movies scenes?
question: Hey there   Favourite avengers movies scenes?  Favourite iron man movies scenes?
answer:
Hi, really any of Tony’s sciencing/ engineering scenes, they’re always the most cinematic and intriguing ones to watch! I think the ones that really own my heart are the new element creation in Iron Man 2 and Tony preparing and breaking into the Mandarin compound in Iron Man 3 and of course any of the arc reactor/ iron man suit building scenes in Iron Man!

Thanks 😉

reblog.comment:
Hi, really any of Tony’s sciencing/ engineering scenes, they’re always the most cinematic and intriguing ones to watch! I think the ones that really own my heart are the new element creation in Iron Man 2 and Tony preparing and breaking into the Mandarin compound in Iron Man 3 and of course any of the arc reactor/ iron man suit building scenes in Iron Man!

Thanks 😉

summary: Hi would you consider signing this petition? Twitter (.) com/MelineStark/status/1121361759141548033?s=20  I want to say, this...
question: Hi would you consider signing this petition? Twitter (.) com/MelineStark/status/1121361759141548033?s=20  I want to say, this petition is not forced, if you don't want to sign, that's ok with us! ;) We just want them to know we're not ok with the ending, maybe in the future they decide to bring Tony back in some way, but we need to make them know we didn't like it because so far they think we do and that we're "satisfied" with the end of his character.
answer:
I already signed this petition! 

I think it’s a good idea letting them know even if they don’t do anything about it.

I think it’s a good idea letting them know even if they don’t do anything about it.

summary: This was the exact moment I start crying in the theater, not when Tony snapped, and not when he was dying surrounded by his...
body:
This was the exact moment I start crying in the theater, not when Tony snapped, and not when he was dying surrounded by his friends and family. This moment, this scene.

I knew Tony was going to sacrifice himself, just because of the way he looked here. He knew what he had to do in this moment, and you can tell. Only one possibility where they win. Only one way.

title: Love Triangle
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2XV1HRy

by SunriseRose1023

Tony’s moved out, Bucky has the job of getting your daughters from house to house, and you’re just trying to put one foot in front of the other. Tony’s still trying to piece everything together, and a chance encounter brings your fragile composure crashing down.

summary: A Happy Iron Man Headcanon (because lord, do I need one)
title: A Happy Iron Man Headcanon (because lord, do I need one)
body:
It is Tony’s personal mission in life to Save Every Cat. And because he is rich and has lots of space, he can do that. Steve has tried to stop him from going to the shelter or bringing home the kittens he finds on the street. But Tony cannot be stopped and will not be stopped. 

Tony funds his cat saving though the litter scooping robot he built and mass produced. It has a play setting too with a laser pointer. It’s not uncommon to see a cat chasing a robot around Avengers tower

Clint has bought him kitschy cat merch as gag gifts but Tony wears them without shame

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: One Year
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2USQzCX

by littlestephen

Peter Parker is a successful CEO and owner of Parker Industries. A young genius, billionaire and, of course, Spider-Man.
After a risky battle against Thanos, the intruder, Peter Parker was almost dying. However, Doctor Strange was helping him in a way.

Now he’s in 2018, a sixteen years old teenager. And he has one year to fix things up before Thanos comes and find him.

or

Peter goes back in time. He has one mission: save the world. But, for that, he needs Tony Stark trust.

Words: 2368, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Characters: Peter Parker, Tony Stark, Ned Leeds, Avengers - Character, Michelle Jones
  • Relationships: Peter Parker & Tony Stark, Michelle Jones & Ned Leeds & Peter Parker, Ned Leeds & Peter Parker, Peter Parker & Avengers Team
  • Additional Tags: Time Travel, Irondad, spiderson, No Avengers: Endgame (Movie) Spoilers


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2USQzCX

by littlestephen

Peter Parker is a successful CEO and owner of Parker Industries. A young genius, billionaire and, of course, Spider-Man.
After a risky battle against Thanos, the intruder, Peter Parker was almost dying. However, Doctor Strange was helping him in a way.

Now he’s in 2018, a sixteen years old teenager. And he has one year to fix things up before Thanos comes and find him.

or

Peter goes back in time. He has one mission: save the world. But, for that, he needs Tony Stark trust.

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: Our old subtle foe
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2GOhefa

by gatty

**ENDGAME SPOILERS**

The world was saved.

But then it wasn’t.

When the Avengers left on earth can’t fix things, there’s only one person left to turn to. The person they’ve always turned to: Tony Stark. Only that’s not such an easy option any more.

Peter volunteers to travel to the afterlife to find him. Because he’s not sure how to do this - and of this - without him.

Words: 3784, Chapters: 1/5, Language: English

blog.name: fantasticescapism
blog.title: Fantastic Escapism
blog.description: Storyteller and fan girl. Multifandom. There are spoilers here; be warned

summary: Regarding RDJ’s mixed feelings on Tony’s fate in Endgame
body:
Regarding RDJ’s mixed feelings on Tony’s fate in Endgame

I’ve seen posts about this article where the Russos said RDJ had mixed feelings regarding Tony’s fate in Endgame and, as expected, some people latched on to that as fuel for more hate towards the Russos and the writers.

I understand that we’re still in mourning but wouldn’t it be better to not jump into conclusions and be angry? We’re not even sure what RDJ’s exact emotions were.

Of course, RDJ would have mixed feelings. He’s been playing this character for years but at the same time, surely there are other things he wants to do. Maybe it’s also bittersweet to him.

I saw this article of RDJ’s interview. Here are some excerpts:

So how difficult was it saying goodbye to Avengers?

Look, we’re show folk. We’re very used to a lifetime of making close associations and breaking away and coming back together.

The thing that (Marvel president) Kevin Feige has provided all of us with is this opportunity to keep reuniting, almost like a regional theatre or a travelling group of odd balls.

Did you know the Endgame ending before you started filming?

Well, knowing Marvel, an ending is an ending until they tell you that was the faux ending.

All of the major artists involved in this have been in dialogue with the filmmakers for some time, and then it just kind of flowed naturally out of that.

But in the Marvel Universe, nothing is final because they have every trick in the book and every device that you can imagine.

I’m not crazy about any film that takes itself too seriously. It’s particularly funny to me how these superhero movies got so heavy.

People get so invested, myself included. But there’s room for a lot of levity in there too.

Speaking of goodbyes, will this be your last movie as Iron Man?

Well, I’m of two minds. One is, if you wanna make God laugh, tell Him your plans. Two is, I know people get very definitive about what they’re doing and what they’re not doing.

But nowadays entertainment isn’t just, “Will you get in front of the camera and put on that outfit and talk like that guy we know?” … I would love to stay in business with Disney and Marvel somehow.

But you know me, how easily bored I can get. The fact that I’ve stuck around this long really means that they’re still engaging on some level.

When will you be returning to making the kind of movies that impressed Altman?

My missus (producer Susan Levin) and I did a film I was really proud of called The Judge, and I’ve done some Sherlocks.

At the same time I have a wide variety of interests. I’m a musician of sorts, and I like other art forms.

But the downside – if there possibly could be one – having had this long standing relationship with Marvel is that you can’t have everything.

So there are certain things that I’ve put on hold for a while, that I’m really looking forward to getting back to.

We recently had this family vacation (with) Oscar Isaac … he’s one of the fantastic actors. And he started talking to me about (work) stuff that I hadn’t even thought about for ages like, “Hey remember, A Winter’s Tale …”. I was like, “Oh yeah, Shakespeare!”

And we started talking about stuff we could do. I’d like to find some of the actors and actresses that I like and maybe think about directing them in something.

It’d be fun to get on the other side of the camera. Either that, or I would hate it. I would just be like, “Oh my God, why don’t we just turn the camera around on me? I’ll show you how to do it!”

—

If I have to jump into conclusion, I believe it’s bittersweet for him. He loves Tony Stark but he seems to be the type of guy who doesn’t like to stay in just one place. Even in interviews, he needed to keep moving. He did say that he would love to keep working with Disney and Marvel, maybe not as Tony Stark. Maybe as a director, we don’t know. We’ll see.
